channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ME
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ME

item.title: Report X-2024010828
item.description:
Report X-2024010828

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: LEWISTON
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the unloading process as the trailer door was opened, the package fell from leaning up against the trailer as well as being placed on top of another package. The package began to leak and was immediately placed in a red hazard tote and brought over to the QA dept. DescribePack: The side of the package was wet, upon investigation 1/4 bottles of acetonitrile was broken and its entire volume had leaked throughout the package. The bottles were contained in the package with corrugated liners. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Once the item was identified as leaking from the unload area it was placed in a red hazard tote, brought over to the QA dept, and the proper personnel were told of the events that took place. Immediately the damage report of the hazmat was initiated. There were two other packages that had there outer packaging damaged but not saturated. Those two other packages were repacked immediately by QA to mitigate the effects of the release.
